content: अनुदात्त {%<ab>a.</ab>%} Grave(accent); not elevated or raised (not pronounced with the Udātta accent); उच्चैरुदात्तः, नीचैरनुदात्तः; accentless, having the neutral, general tone; उदात्तश्चानुदात्तश्च स्वरितश्च त्रयः स्वराः; uttered with the grave accent (as a vowel); प्रयत्नप्रेरितो वायुर्यदोर्ध्वभागे प्रतिहतोऽचं निष्पादयति स उदात्तः; एवमधोनिष्पन्नोऽच् अनुदात्तः; ताल्वादिषु सभागेषु स्थानेषु नीचभागे निष्पन्नोऽच् अनुदात्तः; °त्तं पदमेकवर्जं <ls>Sk.</ls> (The term अनुदात्त is used by Pāṇini for the grave accent which immediately precedes the Udātta, and also for the general accentless tone neither high nor low, termed एकश्रुति, the one monotonous intonation belonging to the generality of syllables in a sentence). --त्तः The grave accent.
